intro: Aphragmus ohbana, commonly known as the Hawaiian spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. Aphragmus ohbana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local insect populations and contributing to the biodiversity of tropical ecosystems.
